So this visit today I showed up and the first thing they did was they cleaned the inside the lingual side of my teeth if you will and they cleaned those so that they could put my permanent bonded or they call it a bonded retainer not a permanent because it can come out in the future and it is not  permanent in that sense. So they call it a bonded retainer. So they cleaned and prepped my teeth, put some conditioner on there so that they could go ahead and apply the permanent retainer. They put in my mouth this plastic contraption that was in the shape of a butterfly that holds your lips out and holds your tongue in the middle of your mouth so that you can't touch anything while they're working. So my permanent retainer goes, spans six teeth on the bottom, four teeth on the top, goes from three to three and two to two for my retainer. So they did that portion, then after they got the wire bonded in top and bottom, they went ahead and popped off every little bracket. And the metal ones, albeit all of the braces being removed was pretty painful because they basically just take  pliers and pop it off. I was a little taken back by that. I thought for some reason that they're going to like melt them off or the UV rays from the light was going to remove them. But no, they just take some pliers and manhandle those sons of guns right off your teeth. So the metal ones aren't bad. They stay together. They pop off. There's a little residual glue left there that they need to polish. But the clear ones, different story. Since they're a mixture of glass  and acrylic, if I am not mistaken there, have some type of glass components to them so when they are being removed, it's not uncommon for them to shatter or for there to be some shards left behind. So there was a little bit of shards, I didn't have a bracket shatter on me when they were taking it off, so that was good. But after they got all of the brackets off top and bottom, they took quite a while  polishing off the residual glue and getting my teeth back to the smooth surface, back to what they were pre-brackets and pre-braces. So that was a little bit of a lengthy process, a little uncomfortable just because my mouth was open for so long and it had dry powder from the glue just kind of sitting on my teeth and gums and I couldn't really swallow or do anything.
